Pre-Game Insights: USA coach Stuart Law said they will not go down without a fight.
USA vice captain Aaron Jones believes his team will get good support from the crowd in the West Indies.
Aaron Jones said his team are excited to rub shoulders with the biggest sides in the world.
Aiden Markram agreed that South Africa will have to be on their best game against the co-hosts in Wednesday's game.
Aiden Markram said it will be vital for his side to gather as much information as they can about each ground.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Antigua pitch has produced a mix of low- and high-scoring matches, but conditions remain favourable for batting.
There will still be some assistance for bowlers, especially wrist spinners and bowlers with high accuracy and control.
The forecast for this week is cloudy and humid with negligible chances of rain.
The teams have never met in any format of the game.
USA lost their last completed match of the tournament against India, but would have gained confidence from their competitive display against the South Asian powerhouse.
South Africa are one of the four unbeaten sides in the tournament so far, but were nearly at the receiving end of a huge upset against Nepal in their last group match.
The USA will welcome back their captain, Monank Patel, who missed the match against India, and left-arm spinner Nosthush Kenjige, who showed plenty of control with the ball against Pakistan.
South Africa may look to play two spinners and call up the wily Keshav Maharaj in place of one of their three pace bowlers.
Others: USA team news: Squad: Monank Patel (captain), Shayan Jahangir, Aaron Jones, Andries Gous, Nitish Kumar, Steven Taylor, Harmeet Singh, Corey Anderson, Milind Kumar, Nisarg Patel, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Ali Khan, Jessy Singh, Saurabh Netravalkar, Nosthush Kenjige

South Africa team news: Squad: Aiden Markram (captain), Quinton de Kock, Reeza Hendricks, Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Ryan Rickelton, Tristan Stubbs, Marco Jansen, Ottneil Baartman, Gerald Coetzee, Keshav Maharaj, Bjorn Fortuin, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, Tabraiz Shamsi
